channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-601] Oozie's POMs should use org.apache.oozie as group
item.summary: Oozie's POMs should use org.apache.oozie as group

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
For pre-0.23, are the artifacts there in maven in apache.

Btw Mona has build Oozie using hadoop-0.23. She will working to making appropriate profile.
This is for Oozie groupId in POMs, not Hadoop's

-----------------------------------------------------------
This is an automatically generated e-mail. To reply, visit:
https://reviews.apache.org/r/2803/
-----------------------------------------------------------

Review request for oozie.

Summary
-------

Oozie's POMs should use org.apache.oozie as group.

Excluding the deployment of the distro JAR which is a dummy

This addresses bug OOZIE-601.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OOZIE-601

Diffs

Diff: https://reviews.apache.org/r/2803/diff

Testing
-------

tested installing them locally 'mvn install -DskipTests' to verify they are installed in the M2 cache with the right group.

Thanks,

Alejandro

> /trunk/distro/pom.xml, line 112

> <https://reviews.apache.org/r/2803/diff/1/?file=58070#file58070line112>

> Why do we need it?

to avoid publishing a dummy distro JAR to Maven repo.

Angelo K. Huang wrote:

Does it mean we don't need to publish jars to central maven any more?

we do, we need to publish oozie-client and oozie-core, not oozie-distro (which is a dummy JAR)

  • Alejandro
